time followed practised feates armes togither vsing order language weapon keeping selfe maner ordring battels insomuch boththe ancient order romane armie order captaines name order romane army whole host diuided three principall part whereof first consisted pikemen second chiefe gentleman lordes third called rereward euery part chiefly compounded footman accompaniedthe romanes diuided armie three part certaine number horseman battels ordered sort placed pikemen foreward right behind nobleman third place behind appointed rereward called name triariy also certaine troups horseman right left side euery part army called wing respect place bicause seemed wing body set foreward close togither forefront might breake vpon enimy sustaine onset battel bicause fight first succour foreward either put woorst driuen backe ioined close kept rank wider asunder might without disorder selfe receiue foreward within mishap breach aray constrained retire rereward rank farther distant one another battel might able receiue within foreward battell neede required battels thus ranged began skirmish pikemen driuen backe vanquished retired distance void space nobleman knit togither one made one bodie two battels began fight againe ioined togither put worst gathered themselues togither wide large rankes left rereward triariy three part ioined one renued fight either lost woonne battell vnable repaire themselues againe therefore rereward entered conflict armie danger whereupon arose prouerbe re redacta est ad triarios asmuch say english matter brought rereward extremitie captaines time hauingthe benefite romane order forsaken order ancient discipline make account ordinance warre although well considered found matter great importance ordreth host may repaire thrice one battell must haue fortune enimie three sundry time loose vtterly ouerthrowne whereas trusteth onely first encounter day offereth himselfe rashly vnto danger losse one onely disorder one smal vertue may cary victorie hindreth army repairing themselues thrice lack skil gather one battel another also appoint onely foreward maine battel part lay hope strength armie vpon horseman wheras ancient made account footman knowne set downe heere two kindes army one furie order romane armie according testimonie history good order continuance time planted warlike discipline nothing doone among rule neither eate sleepe french army furie without order furie beareth sway order falleth often french army victorie doth followe first assaie furie wherein hope consisted succoured setled vertue neither haue confidence furie soone somewhat cooled see neuer little disorder breach aray presently discomfited contrariwise romanes lesse afraid peril bicause good order fought firmely resolutely togither without distrust behauiour people dayes would thinke fauourably delt withall souldiours tooke emperor forbiddeth take vpon paine life truely vnmeasurable licence granted causeth souldior enter field onely spoile rob eschew ight stead helping one another taking care euery one owne horse souldiour beggerlike haue foure lackeis thousand souldiors dayes chargeable people twentie thousand well ordered wouldaurelius punished adulterie theft committed souldiors death romane souldiour committed adulterie oast wife aurelius caused torne sunder two tree bowed downe one another death also take egge hee went ranke whilest armie marched bastonnado oftentimes one simple fault whole legion discharged captaine seuerely punished yet rigor souldiors loued emperour father also gaue pay well truly rewarded liberally duetie way true payment souldiors redresseth many disorder amongst redresse many disorder calamity seene army restore sort warrelike discipline abolished souldiours alleage excuse wicked deedes payd many would bee payd might cloke robbery small taxe since payment fiftie thousand footemen layed vpon subiects king promised imploy mony vpon vse vpo paiment men war also keepe money apart ordinary receipt bicause duely obserued people doubly vexed pay money yet polled side notwithstanding ordinarie charge poore pesants would thinke themselues happie discharged erecting victualing tent men warre skarres many woundes receiued body shield also spoyled thrust many push pike quoth another minde besieged citie samos much ashamed arrowe shotte walles fell harde venturous yong man hazarding selfe giuing place wordes say good wise captaine ought die age least olde small benefit ariseth prosper well contrarywise vniuersall losse generall hurt thing well betide wise man require opinion venture enimies warily remembring saying good emperor antoninus rather saue one citizen tha put thousand enimies death answer scipio like whe earnestly requested souldiours siege numantia gine assault rather quoth haue scipio would haue wayes tried sword vsed warre life one romane death numantines vsed also say thing ought assaied warre sword taken hand deed greater victory gotten without sheding bloud paine care reason cause good men heretofore greatly honored war much sought great captaines bicause religious vndertooke nothing prayed god offered sacrifice maner countrey also done somesouldiors ought begin war prayer end praise thanksgiuing great exploite slouthful giue thanks offrings hymnes song praise good consideration haue place amongst v rest warlike discipline principally regard maner men vsed seruice onely great number may many time knowen bold murderer giuen ouer wickednesse shall preferred office honest man despise owne countreymen whome welfare countrey concerneth well selues rather trust stranger hireling seeke nothing destruction selues also bewaile late mischiefes haue light vpon v cause propound vnto companion discourse vpon election choise considered taking men war man may safely commit thinke good may speak somwhat also maner exhortatio fight vsed ancient bicause touched way former discourse lastly victory ought bee vsed commonly followeth good order discipline war wherof haue hitherto discoursed aser man must vse subiectes warre forasmuch chiefe force armie consisteth sincere constant good souldiors towards fight sought elsewhere owne naturall subiects whome prosperitie good successe common prince amana friend quoth cyrus men war haue chosen bicause haue proofe heretofore manhood bicause yong yeeres haue known ready doe thing countrey account honest eschew dishonestie cannot truely said stranger neuer seen come countrey inrich themselues ouerthrow neighbour belongeth thee aram handle matter propounded vnto v aram consider diligently cause whence came ruine romane empire shall find meanes wisest emperor inuented safetie preseruation thereof turned end destruction first ordinary army placed augustus neere rome border estatethree cause whence proceeded ruine romane empire ouerthrew many successor euen empire self would sometimes set sale deliuer vp gaue next translation empire constantine great made rome bizantiu afterward called name constantinople therby make sure persian people asia greatly hastned forward ouerthrow caried thither chief strength andthe diuision empire weakened wealth rome diuided empire east west e weakned much west first destroyed east continued vnited knit togither might long time maner euer haue resisted inuasions thirdly emperours thought strengthen themselues strange hired forrain power called succour namely gothes thereby weakening owne force naturall strength empire put ere aware rome italy consequently prouinces hand barbarian yea find greatest calamity euer happened commonwealth diuided citizen seuereddangerous estate call forraine succour among themselues called stranger helpe vsing often goe way last made themselues maisters ouer germanes called byas appeereth sequani sequani succour autun compelled deliuer halfe land vnto length drooue away naturall people countrie became lordes greatest part gaules territorie go farre high time v grow wise owne perill faction theby frenchman house orleans burgundy called englishman france meane sette footing therein possessed great part therof long time lacked time frenchman blinded caried away partiality god grant may throughly knowe bring countrie extremitie misery submit seruice slauerie strange yoke vnder colour begging helpe handes letted plaied among v v v cruellest sorrowfull tragedie euer men came hither quarter behold sight would man haue thought great small wittingly purposed ouerthrow goodliest noble kingdome world themselues withall end haue shamefully lost glorie renowne ancestor woorthily gotten good hap hath turned tempest v wils least let v call mind danger whereinto willingly cast selues let v forget admonition giuen v barbarous fellowes whose captaines counsellor asked v called little departure kingdome complained vnto extorsionsthe end forraine souldiours propound themselues cruelty men practised thinke said intent purpose men following v enrich themselues ouerthrow agree among selues neuer call v except ye minde taste shall woorse let v enter particular consideration perill hurt commeth forraine mercenarie souldiours may knowe whome wee ought rather vse armes wherewith prince defendeth countrie either owne hired stranger sent succour prince friend else mingled togither maintaine necessarie prosperitie preseruation euerie happie commonwealth vsereasons forraine force woorth nothing forraine helpe say hired force succour stranger woorth nothing rather dangerous prince thinke ground assurance estate vpon forraine force cannot safely doe agree easily togither doe profite neither well ordered obedient side ouerfaithfull brauerie amonge friendes hartlesse amonge enimies neither feare god faithfull men reason heereof bicause loue anye occasion holdeth paie hope spoyle sufficient cause mooue die willingly seruice whose subiects andthe cause last destruction italy whose ruine desire rather increase last destruction italy came thing bicause trusted longe time forraine hyred force brought thinges passe men soone another stranger came shewed heereuppon came kinge charles eight easily ouerranne italy chalke vse speake saye without resistance sent take vp lodging bicause shoulde haue withstoode called keepe countrie owne accord take parte matter strange hired captaines either excellent men haue nothing bethe discommoditie bringing hired captaines valiant prince trust doubt seeke make themselues great either ouerthrowe maister destroying others captaines haue valure cannot hope thing cause owne perdition succour moste hurtfull estate potentate called force aide defence souldiours may well good profitable themselues alwaies hurtfull call man loose fielde ouerthrowne winne prisoner succour great deale bee feared hired strength obeieth prince calleth requireth helpe man receiueth armie vnited accustomed obeye captaine conducteth bringeth destructiondangerous prince call potentate succour alreadie prepared cannot auoided openeth doore owne house let enimie stronger himselfe therefore expedient euerye prince trye way haue recourse men helpe succour whosoeuer shall reade consider well time past runne ouer present state thing shall see whereas one prospered well infinite number deceiued abused commonwealth ambitious prince coulde wish haue better occasion whereby get possession citie seignorie prouince hee required send armie defende ambition iudgement come second life earth end men may know iudgement come wherin vngodlines men shal corrected neither doth recompence good men blessing world ende may hope place life vertuous shalbe rewarded
